listing.description: This property is a real gem of Wood Green’s Scotch Estate. An expansive three bedroom end of terrace house with a garage and a driveway space. The home provides the potential to add value and refurbish to one’s taste.This property has been in the ownership of the current family for three generations since the 1920’s. This sale is the first opportunity for a new owner to purchase this property in almost a 100 years! The Scotch Estate has a mix of interwar properties including bay-fronted Victorian and Edwardian houses. In its time it has maintained a quiet and calm feeling it and has always been an excellent place for families to reside. It is now made up of many long-standing residents along with the new owners who have flooded the patch due to its vastness of impressive properties like this and of course great transport links.The house is made up two large reception rooms, a galley kitchen leading out to a beautifully kept garden providing light all through the day. The outside space also includes access to the properties garage and driveway space, which allows parking for two cars and ample storage. Perfect for all collecting habits!The upstairs, you find two light-filled and substantially sized bedrooms, a single room and the main bathroom suite of the home. Also on this level, is access to the buildings huge loft space. This style of house commonly accommodates a loft conversion (relevant to standard permissions) giving the new owner the opportunity to add a level to the building allowing the inclusion of a large bedroom and en-suite. If adding space is part of the criteria then extended to the rear is also a usual feature to these homes. The added benefit of the end of terrace would allow a enormous extension to the back of the house.Perth Road itself has ample amenities in its surrounding, these include the public tennis courts which are free to use and a flower park which has received a green flag award, a status only given to the best in London. Just at the bottom of the road you find Lordship Lane. Perfect for those ‘usual bits’ that need to be picked up. The Tesco Express and grocers selling fresh produce contribute significantly to that requirement. Not forgetting the beautiful green spaces in its locality, White Hart Lane park is situated just behind the Scotch Estate and from the street itself you can access the favorite walking park with lovely greenery to match. For recreation, New River Leisure Centre is a 7-minute walk from the house, providing a place for a work out in its newly built gym, a track to run and stretch those legs, football pitches to enjoy the nations favorite sport and lots more!The amenities do not stop there with this property, within 10 minutes you can reach Wood Green Underground (Piccadilly Line Zone 3) which is found connected to the central shopping district of the patch. As well as the Underground you have the array of different shops which include a Shopping Mall along with a range of diverse restaurant’s offering a variety of cuisines. When it comes to shopping and dining the Wood Green High Road is bound to meet all requirements, whether you are looking for clothing, household goods or groceries, there is nothing missed here.The property is offered with 'no onward chain.' Please contact us to arrange a viewing.Think…Property Inc!

listing.description: A stunning semi-detached 1930's family home. Fully refurbished throughout, this house is well proportioned and immaculately presented.The ground floor comprises an entrance porch, a large half bay front reception room, second reception space open plan to a cavernous kitchen/dining area. The space is beautiful, bright, cleverly arranged with doors leading out to the rear garden. The first floor provides three generous sized bedrooms and a stunning brand new bathroom. Further benefits include potential to extend into the loft (subject to planning), shared driveway to a garage and a front garden which has the potential to turn into further off street parking.This property is located in the coveted Woodlands development, a short walk from Isleworth mainline train station, all the amenities of Isleworth village and some fantastic schools.

listing.description: Lock 8 Estates proudly presents a stunning 3 bedroom semi-detached house for sale!PorchA great size porch with space to install storage cupboards and shoe racks. The porch is tilled throughout.Entrance/HallwayThe spacious entrance consists of fully carpeted stairs leading up to the first floor. There is also a generous under stair storage. The hallway is wooden flooring throughout flowing through to the lounge area.Reception 1The cosy large lounge includes large bay window, balanced flue gas fire place and wooden flooring throughout. A good size bathroom withvinyl flooring and casement windows overlooking the garden and flat roof.Master Bedroom The large sized master bedroom can hold a double or king sized bed with fitted wardrobes and overhead storage units. Extra space around the room for dressers, stalls and side tables. The large bay windows overlook the road side.Bedroom 2 The second double bedroom is currently furnished with 2 single beds and 1 large free standing wardrobe. The room also includes casement windows overlooking the garden and flat roof.Bedroom 3The single cosy room consists of a triangular bay window overlooking the road side. The room is currently furnished with a single bed, dresser and a medium size wardrobe.GardenThe garden area includes a stunning summer house with decking, a great size shed and a wooden large patio cover. The large bay windows overlook the road side. Bedroom 2 The second double bedroom is currently furnished with 2 single beds and 1 large free standing wardrobe. The room also includes casement windows overlooking the garden and flat roof. Bedroom 3 The single cosy room consists of a triangular bay window overlooking the road side. The room is currently furnished with a single bed, dresser and a medium size wardrobe. Garden The garden area includes a stunning summer house with decking, a great size shed and a wooden large patio cover. There is a side gate entering the side ally way onto the street this is accessible from the garden. Viewings highly recommended!

listing.letting_fees:
Should you wish to proceed with the rental of a property through Elizabeth Hunt & Associates Ltd, the following costs are applicable:
- An Administrative Deposit, equivalent to approximately one week’s rent, will be payable once an offer has been agreed, subject to contract and references. Upon receipt of this Administrative Deposit, the Landlord will be requested to remove the property from the available rental market. Should you decide not to proceed or you fail the reference process, the Administrative Deposit is non-refundable. However, should you pass the references process, the Administrative Deposit will be full refunded on the start date of your tenancy.
- Prior to the commencement of the tenancy, you will be required to pay, in cleared funds by bacs transfer or bankers draft, the following (personal or company cheques will not be accepted under any circumstances):
O One month’s rent in advance.
O One week’s Administrative Deposit, payable as soon as rental per month agreed.
O One month’s Deposit (2 months Deposit is required if you have pets).
O Tenancy Agreement fee: £230.00 + VAT = £276.00.
O References fee: £40.00 + VAT = £48.00 (per applicant’s references).

Example:
Rent: £1,300.00
Administrative Deposit: £325.00
Deposit: £2,600.00 (no pets)
Tenancy Agreement Fee: £276.00
References Fee: £48.00 (per applicant/tenant)
By start date of tenancy: £4,549.00
Refunded Administrative Deposit: (£325.00)

Total payable by start of tenancy: £4224.00

listing.description: Impeccable three bedroom fully refurbished victorian family home close to upton park station:The PropertyLovingly refurbished to an exacting standard is this extended three double bedroom Victorian family residence with a bright double reception room and wonderful kitchen/diner offering ample dining and entertaining space leading to the low maintenance rear garden. There is a cleverly positioned, contemporary ground floor shower room. Three bright tastefully decorated, double bedrooms can be found to the first floor along with a beautifully fitted family bathroom. The property has potential to be further extended into the loft space subject to planning permission.The LocationThe property is conveniently situated just off Barking Road, close to Upton Park Station and surrounded by an abundance of retail outlets, restaurants and other local amenities. Stratford is also within easy access with its array of shopping and leisure facilities.Our ViewThis property offers generous accommodation and would make a beautiful family home situated in arguably the most convenient part of Upton Park and still has the potential to increase in size.Area GuideShoppingShopping locally is focused around Queens Market and Westfield, one of the largest shopping malls in Europe with around 300 stores, as well as restaurants, a multi-screen cinema, cafés and bars. The Stratford Centre on Broadway is also home to a variety of well-known and independent retailers, and a daily market. Both are around a mile from the development. Central London, with the designer boutiques of Bond Street and Regent Street, as well as iconic department stores, such as Harrods and Selfridges, is around 30 minutes away by DLR and London Underground.LeisureStratford has continued to grow in popularity since it hosted the 2012 Olympics. The Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park and its facilities the London Aquatics Centre, the Lea Valley VeloPark, the London Stadium, the Copper Box Arena (gym and sports hall), and the Lea Valley Hockey and Tennis Centre are all popular sports venues. In addition to the Olympic park, residents are just a 20-minute walk from one of London's oldest public spaces, Victoria Park. The area has also seen an increase in entertainment and leisure destinations, with independent bars, cafés and restaurants throughout the area, as well as popular cultural venues, such as the Theatre Royal Stratford East, Roof East a cinema on top of a multi-storey car park and Stratford Circus Arts Centre.EducationWell-regarded schools near the development include Carpenters Primary School and Old Palace Primary School for young children and East London Science School and Bow School for secondary-age pupils. Post-16 education providers include Newham College, two miles from Legacy Wharf and Tower Hamlets College, around three miles away. The University of East London also has a campus on Water Lane, a 10-minute drive away.TransportFor professionals working in the capital, public transport links are excellent with national rail, Docklands Light Railway and London Underground services within walking distance of these new homes in Stratford, as well as a network of local bus routes into central London. Major roads easily accessible from Legacy Wharf include the A11, the A12 and the A13, while for domestic and international air travel, City Airport is five miles away via the A12. Crossrail services through central London are also due to stop at Stratford Station from late 2019.You may download, store and use the material for your own personal use and research. listing.letting_fees:
Preliminary Payment (Holding Deposit)
Once you have found a property and your offer has been accepted by the landlord, we will require a Preliminary Payment (Holding Deposit)
Between £500.00-£1,000.00 (depending on the value of the property), deducted from your final completion monies.
Standard Fees
Administration fees
We handle all the paperwork and provide a tenancy agreement for you and your landlord to sign. The fee is based on the size of the property, the number of tenants and rental value:
• Up to £1,500.00 pcm:£600.00 per tenancy
• Up to £2,00.000 pcm: £660.00 per tenancy
• Over £2,000.00 pcm: £poa per tenancy
References
Includes an employer’s reference to confirm your income to rent ratio for affordability, a credit history check, confirmation of residency and a previous landlord’s reference (if applicable).
• £60.00 per person

Initial Move in Monies
All the initial move in monies and will need to be paid in cleared funds to us 3 days prior to move in.
Security Deposit
The deposit will be protected as part of the tenancy deposit regulations; we use the industry renowned my|deposits. 6 weeks rent prior to moving into the property, this will be refunded to you at the end of the tenancy minus any deductions, if applicable.
Inventory Check In procedure
A convenient time will be arranged for you to meet with the inventory clerk to formally check you into the property. Prices vary according to the size of the property.
• Studio: £125.00
• 1 Bedroom: £145.00
• 2 Bedrooms: £155.00
• 3 Bedrooms: £175.00
• 4 Bedrooms: £190.00
• 5 Bedrooms: £210.00

Other fees that may apply
Express Administration
Within 5 working days or less
• £120.00
Abortive appointment
In the event that an appointment has been booked with you and you fail to be present at the agreed times without prior notification to us.
• £85.00
Renewing a tenancy
• £120.00 administration fee per tenancy
Credit check at renewal
In some circumstances, it may be a pre agreed requirement for a new credit check to be obtained at the point of renewal.
• £60.00 per person
Landlord references
If you decide to move on and require for us to provide you with a reference to your new agent or landlord.
• £30.00
Tenancy Swap Fees
Administration: Covering contract negotiation, amending terms, updating the tenancy agreement during the tenancy and immigration and visa confirmation.
• £300.00 per tenancy
Referencing: Referencing the new occupant, including identity, financial credit checks, obtaining references from current or previous employers / landlords and any other relevant information to assess affordability
• £60 per tenancy
Note: All prices quoted are inclusive of VAT at 20%.

If you have any questions regarding our fees please feel free to ask a member of staff.

listing.letting_fees:
New Assured Shorthold Tenancies (ast’s) signed on or after 1st June 2019

The following charges are payable or potentially payable by a tenant:
Holding deposit - A maximum of one week’s rent
Security deposit - Five weeks’ rent, rising to six week’s rent when the annual rent is in excess of £50,000
Rent and Utility bills - Payable as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Unpaid rent - Interest at 3% above the Bank of England base rate, as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Lost Keys - Tenants are liable for the cost of replacing any lost keys or security device, including a change of lock or replacement of device if required
Amendments of Tenancy Agreement at Tenant’s Request - £50 per change
Early Surrender of the ast at Tenant’s Request - Should a tenant need to surrender the tenancy early and the Landlord agrees to re-let the property, the liability for the payment of rent will end once a new tenant is found and takes up occupation. However, the tenant will still need to cover the Landlord’s costs in surrendering the tenancy and re-letting the property

Non ast’s signed on or after 1st June 2019

For any individual tenant not renting a property under an Assured Shorthold Tenancy the following charges are also payable:
Tenancy Administration charge - £180 per tenancy
Reference charge - £60 per tenant or guarantor
Check-in charge - £144 per tenancy
Renewal charge - £144 per renewal

If a tenant decides to rent a property through us in the name of a business or company the tenancy administration and reference charge will be £480 for a new tenancy and £240 for every renewal.

All prices are inclusive of VAT.

As a member of The Property Ombudsman (tpo) for sales and lettings we subscribe to tpo’s Codes of Practice. This Government approved independent redress scheme gives consumers additional protection beyond that required by law. Our clients have peace of mind that there is free and fair redress available in the unlikely event of an unresolved dispute involving our agency.

As regulated members of ARLA and RICS this means that any monies we hold is insured. ​​This gives our clients peace of mind and financial protection that their money will always be safe in our hands under the RICS Client Money Protection Scheme.

listing.description: Yopa proudly presents this attractive three bedroom semi-detached 1930's house with a large south facing garden.In our opinion this property is in excellent decorative order with double glazed windows, wood flooring and gas fire central heating. The property benefits a large through reception / family room, a modern fitted kitchen with breakfast area and downstairs WC. Upstairs are three bedrooms including two large doubles with built in wardrobes, a single bedroom and a modern bathroom.One of the many attractive attributes this property has is the beautiful 90 ft south facing garden with patio, lawn, sheds for storage and a lean-to side access. The garden also has space to build a garden room like many neighbouring properties, without impacting on the large lawned area. It has off street parking to the front for two cars, as well as parking on the street for visitors with no parking permits required. There is also potential to extend the loft and reception/family room/kitchen subject to the relevant planning permissions.An internal viewing is highly recommended at your earliest convenience.This is what the current owners say about living at the property:The property is 2 min walk to a parade of shops including a co-op, post-office, pharmacy, bakery, cafe, barbers, hairdressers/nail bar and a dry cleaners. You can also stroll down to Blackheath Standard which has several pubs, cafes and local shops.The house is located within approx. 15 mins walk from Kidbrooke mainline station and 7 min bus journey to Blackheath mainline station providing access to London Bridge, Charing Cross, Waterloo, Cannon Street and Victoria stations. The 386,89 and 178 bus routes are all within a 5 minute walk providing access to Blackheath Village, Kidbrooke Village and Greenwich, with Canary Wharf easily accessible by DLR from Greenwich.There are many parks and green open spaces to enjoy, including Hornfair Park (with the Charlton Lido, cafe, tennis courts and bmx track within its bounds), Charlton House (gardens, play area and skate park), Oxleas Woods, Shrewsbury House and Park, Blackheath tennis club and Blackheath golf club, Blackheath Common and Greenwich Park. The property is also situated 30 secs walk from the newly refurbished Harvey Road playing fields with brand new children's playground, club house, Multi-Use Games Area and newly lawned rugby and football pitches.In addition, the house is within walking distance of two Ofsted "Outstanding" primary school's (Cherry Orchard and Sherington) and many other "Good" primaries are in the locality. The well regarded Leigh Academy Blackheath, a secondary school, will be moving to its new site within a 5 minute walk, on Old Dover Road, by September 2019. The house is also in catchment for the "Outstanding" Harris Academy Greenwich and Eltham Hill girl's school, as well as some of the grammar schools.All in all, this is a great, well located, place to live.EPC band: D

listing.letting_fees:
When renting a property there are various fees to take into account.

A month's rent will be payable in advance as well as a damages deposit equivalent to a month and a half rent.

Additional fees include an administration fee of £240 incl. VAT; referencing fee of £51 incl. VAT for each tenant and guarantor (if required); plus an inventory check in fee typically £85-£150 depending on the size and type of property.

Once you've found a property you like you need to make an offer, you will be asked for an initial deposit (usually a nominal amount) to take the property off the market.

listing.letting_fees:
At The Start Of A Tenancy:

GBP108.00 including VAT per tenant for references
GBP150.00 including VAT for the tenancy agreement
GBP60.00 including VAT for each guarantor if required

The Fee Is For:
Reference applications. These include credit checks, employer references, previous landlord or character references.
Submitting the references to your prospective landlord for approval.
Preparation of the tenancy agreement (including draft agreement) and negotiation of additional clauses.
Preparation of the deed of guarantee if applicable.
General administration.

Inventory Check In:
This fee is available on request and will vary depending on the size of the property and whether the property is furnished or unfurnished. The check in will be carried out by an independent inventory clerk and the fee is only applicable if the landlord opts to have a professional inventory carried out.

During And At The End Of A Tenancy:
The cost to renew the tenancy agreement will be GBP36.00 including VAT. This fee is for negotiating the new term and preparing the renewal document.

The cost to make any amendments to the tenancy agreement during a tenancy will be GBP60.00 including VAT.

At the end of a tenancy the tenant may be required to arrange professional cleaning or pay a check out fee. These fees vary depending on the size of the property and whether it is furnished or unfurnished.

listing.description: The present owners have lived here very happily for over 40 years, but their future plans mean that you are now presented with an exciting opportunity to make this attractive house your new home. They will hand over an excellent, well-maintained property for you to enjoy. No need for your diy skills here, just unpack your bags and make yourself at home. The property comprises five bedrooms spread over three floors plus the added bonus of fully refurbished and habitable cellar space. Deceptive from the outside this beautiful brick build home will welcome you with a lovely entrance into a spacious hallway where you can start admiring the original features belonging to Victorian properties including amazing high ceilings throughout. The extensive through lounge offers an abundance of light added to a commodious and very comfortable space. Additional dining/reception room separate from the through lounge and the kitchen will allow extra family time together. The property also benefits from an exceptionally well-proportioned sized kitchen leading to a good size garden. The property accommodates three wc's including one family bathroom on the first floor. Viewings are highly recommended to avoid disappointment.Cecil road is a sought after and enviably located for access to Plaistow and Upton Park underground stations as well as Forest Gate and Stratford. A host of transport links also offers fast access to the City & Canary Wharf. Close to the famous West Ham park where you can enjoy time with your children, dog walking, running or just plain simple relaxing. Westfield shopping centre is also easily accessible.There are five DLR stations within Stratford offering direct links to Canary Wharf, the Royal Docks, Tower Hill, London Excel and London City Airport. Stratford is also well served by bus routes in and around London. Not only is Stratford an established district comprising Victorian terraced homes along residential streets, with educational and sporting facilities at the Olympic Park which is located on your doorstep and is referred to as The Queen Elizabeth Park. Westfield being the vibrant and exciting area with its many attractions ranging from fine arts to various eateries with authentic flavours from all corners of the world. Shopping is not limited here with all major brands located in Europe's largest indoor mall. Opened its doors to the public in 2011 and has already welcomed many shoppers catering to people from all walks of life. There is much to discover locally and be involved in.Additional Information:Council Tax: Band DEnergy Performance Certificate (EPC) Rating:Band D (55-68)Marketed by EweMove Sales & Lettings (Stratford & Forest Gate) - Property Reference 19123

listing.short_description:
This three bedroom halls adjoining family home is situated just a few moment's walk from Stoneleigh Broadway and railway station, as well as local schools and parkland. The property has been thoroughly refurbished in recent years and has a kitchen / dining / living space across the rear with double doors to the garden. A lounge to the front has a bay window allowing in lots of natural light.

Upstairs are three generously proportioned bedrooms, including a larger than average third bedroom, all bedrooms are served by the stylish, contemporary family bathroom. As a halls adjoining property it is particularly well laid out for a potential loft conversion, subject to the usual planning constraints. To the front of the property is a brick block driveway, whilst to the rear is a detached single garage and 111ft lawned garden. Early viewing highly recommended by sole agents.

Stoneleigh is a highly sought after residential area with a bustling Broadway of shops and restaurants at its heart, as well as a mainline railway station with services to Waterloo every twenty minutes. There is a choice of infant and junior schools within the immediate vicinity and the Historic Nonsuch Park runs alongside the South East side. Both the M25 and A3 are easily accessible giving a straight forward route to London and both Heathrow and Gatwick international airports. Tenure: Freehold.

listing.short_description:
Offering the best of well maintained accommodation and three levels of functional living spaces, is this three bedroom, end of terraced property, situated close to the good local amenities of Borehamwood's High Street. As you enter the property, the ground floor comprises of an entrance hall with door into an open plan kitchen/dining/family room, double doors into a conservatory and a cloakroom. On the first floor are two double bedrooms and a family bathroom, whilst the 24ft master bedroom complete with en-suite can be found on the second floor. The heart and hub of the home is the superb open plan kitchen/dining/living room. A comfortable room filled with natural daylight via bi-folding doors that lead to the side of the rear garden. The conservatory is the perfect room for private living. The kitchen area has been fitted with modern wall and base units complemented by contrasting worktop surfaces and integrated appliances. Externally the property enjoys a low maintenance rear garden which is mainly laid to lawn and enclosed by timber boundary fencing. Coleridge Way is located in the popular and sought-after south side of Borehamwood, The railway station is a 5-minute walk with an approximately journey of 16 minutes in to Kings cross and is within the catchment of the ever popular Yavneh College primary school.

listing.description: Location  Lansdowne Road is a sought after road in West Ewell within close proximity of all local amenities.The property is less than a mile from West Ewell train station which offers an excellent service into London for the commuter.There are many local shops nearby, as well as Ewell Village which offers a range of boutique shops and restaurants.For leisure activities, Horton Park Golf Course is just minutes walk away, and Hobbledown Farm is a firm favourite for all of the family to enjoy.Accommodation  This bungalow has been lovingly refurbished throughout to provide high quality living for any new owner.The accommodation briefly comprises entrance hall, two double bedrooms with built in wardrobes and a modern bathroom. There is a spacious living room and an extended kitchen/family room with a vast skylight allowing plenty of natural light to flood through. This room certainly provides the "wow" factor and is the hub of this wonderful home.There are French doors leading to the rear garden which stretches to around 100ft and features a patio area, perfect for the entertaining in the Summer months. The remainder of the garden is laid to lawn and features mature shrubs and plants.To the front of the property is a driveway providing off street parking.Call us now to arrange your internal viewing, we are open 7 days a week, from 8am-8pm.

listing.description: If you do not want to worry about doing anything when you move in, this refurbished home has to be the one for you. You will be able to enjoy the ultra-convenience of the fact that amenities, shops, restaurants, trams, buses and schools are just down the road.You will be pleasantly surprised how quickly you can get home with the various transport links within such easy reach. This stunning home can only be described as stylish and fresh; it is perfect for entertaining as the open plan kitchen/diner is a fantastic to invite friends and family over.Furthermore, there is also a separate lounge where you can put your feet up and unwind after a long day at work. If you find yourself with a house full, there is plenty of room upstairs for people to stay the night and ample room for a growing family. The bathroom provides the perfect environment for that long awaited well-earned soak in the tub. In warmer weather, the rear garden is a great place for the little ones to play in or for you to fire up the barbecue and cook up a storm.Finally, let's consider the location. There are excellent bus routes to East Croydon station, which has fast and frequent trains to London. This will ensure that getting to work or the latest West End show is easier than ever before. If you are looking to just pack your packs and move into a home, then look no further!What the Owner says:It has been a great experience to be able to design, plan and refurbish this home. listing.description: Detailed Description**guide price: £550,000 - £570,000** Refurbished to the highest of standards sits this three double bedroom, period home on one of New Eltham's most desirable roads. Benefiting from a rear extension and converted loft this property offers plenty of internal living space and will make a great starter home for a young family. The property is situated on Reventlow Road which offers an easy commute to New Eltham Rail Station, plenty of local amenities and good schools.The ground floor comprises a reception room and large kitchen / diner which is fully equipped with integrated appliances, a heated tiled floor and bi-folding doors which open onto the low maintenance rear garden. The rear garden which also houses a brick built outbuilding, has been landscaped with a natural stone patio and a brick built fire pit creating the perfect ambience for a warm summers evening.Furthermore the first floor offers two good sized double bedrooms one of which benefits from fitted wardrobes whilst the other screams luxury with Amtico wooden flooring. The main family bathroom is also situated on the first floor and is in keeping with the high specs around the property offering an integrated television and contemporary three piece suite with a shower over bath. The converted loft offers a large master bedroom suite with a Juliette Balcony overlooking the garden; integrated drinks cooler and an ensuite shower room fitted with a glass block screen for privacy allowing natural light to flood the area.Location:Reventlow Road is a quiet, no through road within close proximity to New Eltham rail station and various local amenities.New Eltham is an area of south east London, in the London Boroughs of Greenwich and Bexley. It lies south east of Eltham and north west of Sidcup. New Eltham station serves the area, with services to Central London and Gravesend. New Eltham is served by several Transport for London bus services connecting it with Beckenham, Bexleyheath, Bromley, Catford, Chislehurst, Eltham, Lewisham, New Addington, New Cross, Sidcup and Swanley.This area is sought after for young professionals seeking a happy medium between city living and suburbia due to its great range of local pubs and restaurants and easy commute. The neighbouring shops include a Co-op supermarket, newsagents, a butchers, restaurants and The Beehive public house. Neighbouring Chislehurst, Sidcup and Eltham equally provide a wide range of restaurants and bars for an evening out all within a short cab ride.External : External, A typical period house with a large bay window and a well kept appearance. A brick fronted facade greets you with wrought iron railings mounted on a walled garden in-keeping with the properties exterior.Reception Room : 14'2" x 8'11" (4.32m x 2.72m), The reception room boasts a large bay window and is decorated to a neutral standard with mood lighting and Amtico Wooden Flooring. A modern radiator sits beside the bay window allowing more space for general furniture.Kitchen : 15'1" x 11'4" (4.60m x 3.45m), The kitchen is fully fitted and offers integrated Bosch appliances and an integrated wine cooler with American style Fridge Freezer. The stone effect tile floor is also heated and continues through into the dining area.Dining Area : 9'2" x 7'8" (2.79m x 2.34m), The dining area sits off the kitchen and is within the rear extension which overlooks the easy to maintain rear garden. Containing a large sky light, the dining area benefits from plenty of natural light which compliments the decor throughout.Master Bedroom : 16'9" x 15'1" (5.11m x 4.60m), The master bedroom offers a great space and provides the added benefits of an integrated wine chiller, wet room style open shower; glass brick block wall and a Juliette Balcony.Third Bedroom : 11'6" x 9'1" (3.51m x 2.77m), The third bedroom is located toward the front of the property and benefits from Amtico flooring, the same used in the reception room. The second bedroom also offers a double glazed window with radiator beneath.Second Bedroom : 11'4" x 9'1" (3.45m x 2.77m), The second bedroom overlooks the rear garden and is currently used as a fitted wardrobe. Equal in size as the third bedroom this room can be converted into a good sized double room if required. Also contains a double glazed window and radiator beneath.

New Assured Shorthold Tenancies (ast’s) signed on or after 1st June 2019

The following charges are payable or potentially payable by a tenant:
Holding deposit - A maximum of one week’s rent
Security deposit - Five weeks’ rent, rising to six week’s rent when the annual rent is in excess of £50,000
Rent and Utility bills - Payable as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Unpaid rent - Interest at 3% above the Bank of England base rate, as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Lost Keys - Tenants are liable for the cost of replacing any lost keys or security device, including a change of lock or replacement of device if required
Amendments of Tenancy Agreement at Tenant’s Request - £50 per change
Early Surrender of the ast at Tenant’s Request - Should a tenant need to surrender the tenancy early and the Landlord agrees to re-let the property, the liability for the payment of rent will end once a new tenant is found and takes up occupation. However, the tenant will still need to cover the Landlord’s costs in surrendering the tenancy and re-letting the property

Non ast’s signed on or after 1st June 2019

For any individual tenant not renting a property under an Assured Shorthold Tenancy the following charges are also payable:
Tenancy Administration charge - £180 per tenancy
Reference charge - £60 per tenant or guarantor
Check-in charge - £144 per tenancy
Renewal charge - £144 per renewal

If a tenant decides to rent a property through us in the name of a business or company the tenancy administration and reference charge will be £480 for a new tenancy and £240 for every renewal.

All prices are inclusive of VAT.

listing.description: Silverman Black is delighted to offer this outstanding refurbished and extended four bedroom semi-detached family home, located only about a five minute walk away from Carshalton br station. Taken back to the bare brickwork, the house has been almost completely rebuilt inside and out, with a large two storey rear extension. The accommodation incorporates, a good size entrance hall, a parlour lounge, ground floor cloak/shower room and an enormous open plan kitchen/dining/living space with bi-fold doors opening to an 80 ft west-facing rear garden - whilst upstairs there are four good sized bedrooms, a brand new family bathroom and a large loft which affords some potential for further extension, if required (stpp). Outside, the front garden has been completely block paved to provide off street parking for 3-4 vehicles, whilst the rear garden has been prepared for the new owners to landscape it, but incorporates a beautiful old motor car, which would appear to date from the 1920's, as a feature! Literally, pretty much everything in the house is new and unused - although the developer has retained some or the original leaded light "Crittal" windows to the front - retaining some of the more period charm of the original house. Viewing is strongly recommended - so call today to book your appointment.Property FeaturesAn original beamed semi detached house which has been completely refurbished and massively extended to provide exceptional family accommodationFour good size bedrooms, two bathrooms, a parlour lounge and a huge 320 sq ft open plan kitchen/dining/living room with bi-fold door to the rear terrace and gardenLocated only about a five minute walk away from Carshalton br station, overlooking Wrythe Green and adjacent to Carshalton Girls secondary schoolExternally, there is block-paved off street parking for 3 - 4 vehicles, whilst the rear garden, which has been prepared for landscaping or seeding, extends around 80 ft and enjoys a sunny westerly aspectEPC rating: TBCViewing is highly recommended - so book your appointment today

listing.description: This stunning five bedroom terraced house is situated a short walk away from Woodford Central Line station so your commute into the City would be swift and stress free. This home has recently been extended and refurbished to provide a versatile and beautiful home for an established family. To the ground floor the cosy front room compliments the large kitchen/diner which stretches across the back of the property so for either a quiet night in or a family occasion it's easily accommodated.There is a ground floor bathroom which is handy if the children have been playing in the garden and it also alleviates the early morning rush out the door for work or school. To the first floor there are three bedrooms, (two of them are doubles), and a shower room. To the second floor the loft has been converted to provide two further bedrooms and a wet room. It was noticeable just how peaceful and quiet the house is. It also sits on a elevated position to the road with houses opposite so the views stretch far and wide across the local area and with the Juliet balcony to one of them, waking up and taking in the fresh morning air will never fail to put a smile on your face. There is a very large garden to the rear affording all the space you could need whether it's for the children to play, grow your own vegetables, have garden parties or just to relax and unwind in the warmer months.Agents note: The vendors have been granted permission for a single storey extension (6 x 6 meters). Further details can be obtained if required.What the Owner says:We moved from Snaresbrook to this location as we wanted access to the City alongside fantastic local amenities. Raylodge Primary school currently has an outstanding rating on Ofsted. Raylodge Park is a wonderful place to spend with family at the weekend. Very recently we converted the loft which provides a huge amount of versatility to our home. Apart from that we have laid new carpets, plastered, painted and decorated and all of this was done with a view of staying here long term so no expense was spared. This is a friendly street and we have lovely neighbours and can't express enough just how quiet it is here. It really is the best of both worlds as within a short walk you can reach an abundance of amenities and still return to a peaceful environment.Room sizes:Ground floorEntrance PorchEntrance HallLounge 12'8 x 12'5 (3.86m x 3.79m)Kitchen/Diner 18'9 x 10'5 (5.72m x 3.18m)StorageBathroomFirst floorLandingBedroom 1 12'6 x 11'0 (3.81m x 3.36m)Bedroom 2 10'7 x 8'0 (3.23m x 2.44m)Bedroom 5 7'7 x 6'4 (2.31m x 1.93m)Shower RoomSeperate WCSecond floorLandingBedroom 3 12'7 x 10'3 (3.84m x 3.13m)Juliet BalconyBedroom 4 15'0 x 7'3 (4.58m x 2.21m)Wet RoomOutsideFront GardenLarge Rear GardenOutside Storage ShedThe information provided about this property does not constitute or form part of an offer or contract, nor may be it be regarded as representations.
